owe.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you
owe.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: How much do I owe you  (=often used to show that you want to pay for something)?
I still owe you for the taxi.
the money owed to credit card companies
owe.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to feel that you should do something for someone or give someone something, because they have done something for you or given something to you
owe.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: He asked for help from a colleague who owed him a favour.
Thanks a lot for being so understanding about all this – I owe you one (=used to thank someone who has helped you, and to say that you are willing to help them in the future)!
I owe Shaun a letter; I must write soon.
Let’s go and see Joe – he owes me!
owe.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to have something or achieve something because of what someone else has done
owe.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He probably owes his life to her prompt action.
owe.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to know that someone’s help has been important to you in achieving something
owe.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: He owes a great deal to his publishers.
‘I owe my parents a lot, ’ he admitted.
owe somebody a lot/owe somebody a great deal
I owe it all to you.
owe it all to somebody/owe everything to somebody
the debt that we owe to our teachers
owe.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: to be successful because of the good effect or influence of something or someone
owe.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Their success owes more to good luck than to careful management.
Pearson’s work owed much to the research of his friend, Hugh Kingsmill.
owe.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: to need to pay someone for something they have sold to you or because they have lent you money – used especially when talking about particular amounts of money
The football club still owes £2.3 million.
to owe money, especially to several different companies – used when talking about a person’s financial situation
We started getting deeper and deeper into debt.
to owe an amount of money to your bank because you have taken more money out of an account than you have put in
He received a letter saying he was overdrawn.
The bank charged me even though I was only a few pence overdrawn.
to be overdrawn, with the agreement of your bank
When I finished college I had a big overdraft.
to have spent more money than you have
The firm is £190,000,000 in the red.
owe.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to have not yet paid someone money you should pay them, or to have not yet paid back money you borrowed
owe.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: She owes taxes for the past three years.
He owes the company $2000 for components it supplied.
We still owe the builder for the work on the roof.
